name: ListIncidentLogEntries
description:
Retrieve log entries for a specific incident.

Use this tool to obtain a list of log entries related to a specific incident, which represents a problem that needs resolution. This tool should be called when you need detailed records of events concerning an incident.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the incident to retrieve log entries for.

value_schema.description: The ID of the resource.

parameters.name: versioning_header
parameters.description: The versioning header for the API request, specified using the `Accept` header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: response_content_type
parameters.description: Set the response content type. Use 'application/json' for JSON format.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of results to display per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_start_offset
parameters.description: Specifies the starting point for pagination to search results. Use an integer value.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: results_time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone for rendering the results, defaults to the account time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the range to search log entries. Expected format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Specify the end date for the log entry search range. Format as 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: additional_models_to_include
parameters.description: Array of additional models to include in the response, such as 'incidents', 'services', 'channels', or 'teams'.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses for more detailed information. Defaults to null for faster responses.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: return_important_changes_only
parameters.description: If `true`, returns a subset of log entries showing only the most important changes to the incident.

value_schema.description: If `true`, will return a subset of log entries that show only the most important changes to the incident.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: is_overview
parameters.description: If `true`, will return a subset of log entries that show only the most important changes to the incident.

value_schema.description: If `true`, will return a subset of log entries that show only the most important changes to the incident.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the resource.

value_schema.description: The ID of the resource.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
